cab.content: DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY Off HIS BRITA^IIg ^IJAJESTy^S....GOVERNMENT .) SECRET,.,, WAR CABINET.G.T.. 6829,PARENT FOR POOD SUPPLIED. TO. GgmiANY. Note, "by the Chancellor of. the Exchequer.The Chancellor of the Exchequer asks leave, as a matter of urgency, to take the decision of tho War Cabinet on a divergence of aims which has appeared among the' British' Delegatea in Paris in regard to payment for food supplied tt) Germany.Mr. Bonar Law stated the views of the British Govern-ment to the Supreme War-Council (1.0.105")* was supported by the Americana;and their united opinion prevailed against the French.. Mr..Hughes, in the Reparation Commission, has ,"now adopted the French view.Immediate instructions are required for the guidance of the British Delegates.2 Whitehall Gardens, S-.-W.-l. I9th February, 1919 .1.1
